subject: Leadership
title: Ethical Blind Spots
description: A 60-second lesson on Ethical Blind Spots.

hook.text: Good people do bad things and don't see it. Ethical blind spots are invisible to the person who has them.

buildup.text: Bazerman and Tenbrunsel: bounded ethicality means our ethical behavior falls short of our ethical intentions routinely.

discovery.text: We overestimate our future morality. In hypothetical scenarios we're heroes; in real ones we often stay silent.

twist.text: Framing matters. Call it 'aggressive accounting' and it feels fine. Call it 'fraud' and suddenly it's unthinkable.

climax.text: Seek outside perspectives. Ask trusted critics to challenge your reasoning. Blind spots need another pair of eyes.

punchline.text: The worst ethical failures feel perfectly justified at the time.

quiz.question: What is bounded ethicality?
options: Perfect ethical behavior in all situations
Our ethical behavior routinely falls short of our intentions
Ethics that only apply within company boundaries
